page.title: 10FARMING
page.content: The Farmer's name is Mr. Newman.It is a farm on low lying ground on the east bank of the River Isbourne,which rises to about a 100m.The slope affects what the farmer can grow.On the high slope they grow plums.The soil texture is a clay sand mix and hard to work when wet.This brings a problem to the farmer.The farmhouse faces south-east.The farm area is 588 acres-20 pasture,25 plums remainder arable.Wheat of which 250 acres is grown,is the main crop and marketed by the West Midland Farmer's Co-operative.Other crops are beans and barley.There is a crop rotation which is 2 wheat,1 barley and 1 beans.The farm shop sells plums,eggs and strawberries.
